intro: Eremiris lactea var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to dry environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a tubular corolla, typical of the family. The leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its drought-resistant traits.
